masterRows.detail_text:
Digimon ReArise is a simulation RPG in which players go
on adventures with Digimon. Enjoy stories set in the
Digimon universe and experience life with Digital Monsters within the game.
Players become Digimon Tamers and work together with other Tamers as you complete Quests.

The DigiTown is where your Digimon Partner and friends reside.
You can attend to their needs and make preparations for Quests here.

Attribute is a unique characteristic that each Digimon has. There are 9 types in total:
- Fire - Water - Plant - Earth - Wind - Electric - Holy - Dark - Void
What a Digimon likes depends on their Attribute. Attribute also influences what materials are needed for Digivolving. A Digimon's Attribute may also change through Digivolution.

Each floor brings the chance of earning rewards by defeating the enemies. A floor cannot be repeated after it has been cleared. Difficulty increases as you progress.
Progressing in Underworld Clearing the current floor will allow you to move on to the next one. It is not possible to skip floors, so you must clear each one in order to proceed.
Rewards Rewards are available for each floor. Some rewards can only be acquired in Underworld.
Friends' Progress Status In Underworld Abyss, your friends' progress status will be displayed and you can check each other's progress.

[Status Abnormalities]
[img width=48 height=48]icon/battlecondition/icon_battlecondition_shock[/img] Shock 　Electric attacks can cause this status abnormality that prevents 　Digimon from using their normal attacks or skills for a certain number of turns. [img width=48 height=48]icon/battlecondition/icon_battlecondition_paralysis[/img] Paralysis 　Vegetation Digimon can cause this status abnormality that prevents 　Digimon from using their normal attacks or skills for a certain number of turns. [img width=48 height=48]icon/battlecondition/icon_battlecondition_ice[/img] Freeze 　Ice causes this status abnormality that prevents 　Digimon from using their normal attacks or skills for a certain number of turns. 　While Frozen, the Digimon will not be affected by any action taken 　by an ally or enemy (outside of Unfreeze). [img width=48 height=48]icon/battlecondition/icon_battlecondition_stun[/img] Stun 　Confusion causes this status abnormality that prevents 　Digimon from using their normal attacks or skills for a certain number of turns. [img width=48 height=48]icon/battlecondition/icon_battlecondition_sleep[/img] Sleep 　Your Digimon falls asleep, causing them to be unable 　to use their normal attacks or skills for a certain number of turns. [img width=48 height=48]icon/battlecondition/icon_battlecondition_poison[/img] Poison 　Poison causes Digimon to take damage 　over time. [img width=48 height=48]icon/battlecondition/icon_battlecondition_burn[/img] Burn 　Burned Digimon take damage 　over time. [img width=48 height=48]icon/battlecondition/icon_battlecondition_error[/img] Error 　Corrupts a Digimon, making them take damage 　over time. [img width=48 height=48]icon/battlecondition/icon_battlecondition_seal[/img] Skill Lock 　Locks Main, Sub, and EX Skills, 　preventing their use. [img width=48 height=48]icon/battlecondition/icon_battlecondition_darkness[/img] Blind 　Darkness obscures a Digimon's vision, 　preventing use of normal attacks or Counters 　and reducing the accuracy of skills.

[Null]
[img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff025[/img] Shock Null 　Resists 100% of Shock attacks. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff029[/img] Paralysis Null 　Resists 100% of Paralysis attacks. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff020[/img] Freeze Null 　Resists 100% of Freeze attacks. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff024[/img] Stun Null 　Resists 100% of Stun attacks. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff023[/img] Sleep Null 　Resists 100% of Sleep attacks. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff021[/img] Poison Null 　Resists 100% of Poison attacks. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff010[/img] Burn Null 　Resists 100% of Burn attacks. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff027[/img] Error Null 　Resists 100% of Error attacks. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff026[/img] Skill Lock Null 　Resists 100% of Skill Lock attacks. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff022[/img] Blind Null 　Resists 100% of Blind attacks. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff043[/img] Block Rate Down Null 　Resists 100% of Block Rate Down attacks. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff044[/img] Counter Rate Down Null 　Resists 100% of Counter Rate Down attacks. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff045[/img] Critical Rate Down Null 　Resists 100% of Critical Rate Down attacks. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff046[/img] Pinpoint Rate Down Null 　Resists 100% of Pinpoint Rate Down attacks. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff047[/img] PWR Damage Resist Down Null 　Resists 100% of PWR Damage Resist Down attacks. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff048[/img] TEC Damage Resist Null 　Resists 100% of TEC Damage Resist Down attacks. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff062[/img] Critical Guard 　No critical damage is taken. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff077[/img] Fade Null 　Resists 100% of Fade effects.

[Buffs]
[img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff013[/img] PWR Up 　Increases PWR-type attack power. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff015[/img] TEC Up 　Increases TEC-type attack power. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff011[/img] DEF Up 　Increases Digimon's DEF. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff008[/img] Critical Rate Up 　Raises chance of dealing a critical attack. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff017[/img] Pinpoint Rate Up 　Raises chance of dealing a pinpoint attack. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff018[/img] Counter Rate Up 　Raises chance of countering. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff019[/img] Block Rate Up 　Raises chance of blocking. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff034[/img] PWR Damage Resist Up 　Increases resistance to PWR-type attacks. 　Less susceptible to damage from PWR types. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff035[/img] TEC Damage Resist Up 　Increases resistance to TEC-type attacks. 　Less susceptible to damage from TEC types. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff039[/img] Max HP Up 　Increases Digimon's Max HP. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff040[/img] Total PWR Up 　Increases PWR-type attack power. 　This effect can be stacked and 　will be accumulated to a set value. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff063[/img] Total TEC Up 　Increases TEC-type attack power. 　This effect can be stacked and 　will be accumulated to a set value. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff064[/img] Upgrade Block 　Increases damage reduction 　when Blocking an enemy. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff072[/img] Counter Damage Up 　Increases the amount of damage dealt by a counter.
Personality's Bane 　Increases damage against Digimon with certain Personalities. 　Certain Personalities will also be easier to target. 　*Not applicable to Specials. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff067[/img] • Brave/Super Brave's Bane [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff068[/img] • Calm/Super Calm's Bane [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff069[/img] • Deft/Super Deft's Bane [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff070[/img] • Tenacious/Super Tenacious's Bane [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff071[/img] • Devoted/Super Devoted's Bane
Status Abnormality Bane 　Increases damage against Digimon 　with certain status abnormalities. 　Digimon with certain status abnormalities 　will also be easier to target. 　*Not applicable to Specials. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff086[/img] • Shock Bane [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff083[/img] • Paralysis Bane [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff088[/img] • Stun Bane [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff087[/img] • Sleep Bane [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff084[/img] • Poison Bane [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff080[/img] • Burn Bane [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff082[/img] • Error Bane [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff085[/img] • Skill Lock Bane [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff081[/img] • Blind Bane [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff092[/img] X-Antibody 　Reduces fixed damage caused by X-Charge. 　Ignores X-Barrier and deals damage. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff093[/img] Future Weaver 　Increases damage against Spirals that appear in the 　Season Two vs. Guardians Main Story and afterwards. 　(Not applicable to Specials.)

[Debuffs]
[img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff014[/img] PWR Down 　Decreases PWR-type attack power. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff016[/img] TEC Down 　Decreases TEC-type attack power. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff007[/img] DEF Down 　Decreases Digimon's DEF. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff009[/img] Critical Rate Down 　A debuff where the Digimon has a lower chance of dealing a critical attack. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff031[/img] Counter Rate Down 　A debuff where the Digimon has a lower chance of countering. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff032[/img] Block Rate Down 　A debuff where the Digimon has a lower chance of blocking. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff030[/img] Pinpoint Rate Down 　A debuff where the Digimon has a lower chance of dealing a pinpoint attack. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff036[/img] PWR Damage Resist Down 　Decreases resistance to PWR-type attacks. 　More vulnerable to damage from PWR types. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff037[/img] TEC Damage Resist Down 　Decreases resistance to TEC-type attacks. 　More vulnerable to damage from TEC types. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff078[/img] HP Recovery Down 　Decreases the amount of HP recovered from HP Recovery and Self-Regeneration. 　*Not applicable to HP Absorb and Revive. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff079[/img] Status Abnormality Resistance Down 　Decreases resistance to status abnormalities, increasing the chance of abnormalities 　being inflicted. 　*Fade is not affected.

[Special]
[img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff012[/img] Provoke 　Directs enemy attacks toward the user. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff038[/img] Self-Regeneration 　Recovers a set amount of HP periodically. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff041[/img] Attack Evasion 　Evades enemy's attack. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff053[/img] Dragon's Power 　Accumulate power each time you attack. Increases damage when using a skill 　when power has been accumulated. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff065[/img] Damage Limit 　Reduces the amount of damage received by a set amount. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff042[/img] CT Boost (Cooldown Boost) 　Skill CT is shortened by a set amount. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff074[/img] Auto Revive 　Activates after a Digimon is K.O.'d. The Digimon will be revived with a set amount of HP. 　Auto Revive is a Buff Skill that can be affected by Remove Buff. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff066[/img] Shield 　Creates a shield that absorbs a set amount of damage 　received from an opponent. 　If the damage exceeds a certain amount, the shield will disappear. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff075[/img] Fade 　Inflict Fade on opponents. 　Digimon will be covered in red aura when inflicted with Fade. 　Each time an action is taken, Fade effect will worsen. 　After a set number of actions are taken, 　a K.O. will occur, regardless of remaining HP. 　*Actions that cause Fade to progress include 　　Main Skill, Sub Skill, EX Skill, 　　Normal Attack, Counter, and Pursuit. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff076[/img] Cover 　Directs all enemy attacks towards the user. 　Takes all attacks, including skills that hit multiple targets. 　Reduces damage received by a set amount. 　(Attacks, Debuffs, Status Abnormalities, and Remove Buff will be concentrated on a single Digimon with Cover.) [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff089[/img] Fury 　When your remaining health is below a certain amount, 　you will receive various Buffs. 　*It will activate only once per battle. 　*If K.O.'d and then revived, the activation counter will be reset. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff090[/img] X-Charge 　Causes fixed damage that can only be reduced with X-Antibodies. [img width=48 height=48]icon/buff/icon_buff091[/img] X-Barrier 　Reduces damage from Digimon that do not possess X-Antibodies.

*Some effects may be nullified in certain Clash Battles.
A place where you can spend cash to purchase DigiRubies.

A place where you can spend DigiRubies to purchase items.
The amount of available stock varies per item, and an item cannot be purchased once its available stock drops to zero. Items are restocked over time.

A place where you can trade collected BP medals for items. BP medals are earned in the Battle Park.
The amount of available stock varies per item, and an item cannot be purchased once its available stock drops to zero. Items are restocked over time.

A place where you can trade collected CB medals for items. CB medals are earned in Clash Battles.
The amount of available stock varies per item, and an item cannot be purchased once its available stock drops to zero. Items are restocked over time.

A place where you can trade collected Social Pt. for items. Social Points can be earned by greeting friends and encountering other Tamers.
The amount of available stock varies per item, and an item cannot be purchased once its available stock drops to zero. Items are restocked over time.

In the Battle Park, you can engage in combat with Teams of Digimon raised by other Tamers. Spend BP Stamina to join in these battles. BP Stamina recovers over time. You can also spend DigiRubies to fully recover your BP Stamina.
Victory is achieved when all opposing Digimon are defeated, or if you have more HP than the enemy team when time runs out.

Tamers are Ranked when they participate in the Battle Park. All Tamers begin at the lowest Rank: Rookie Tamer.
The number of Battle Points (BP) a player has determines their Rank. Victories or losses in the Battle Park will cause you to gain or lose Battle Points respectively. The more you win, the more Battle Points you will receive, increasing your Rank.
Win in the Battle Park during a Season, raising your Rank every time you receive a set amount of Battle Points.
The following two conditions can cause your Rank to fall at the end of the Season: 1. Fighting fewer than 35 battles in the Battle Park; 2. Having a win-lose ratio below 49% for the Season. Fulfilling either of these conditions will lower your Rank and BP by one grade when you start the next season. *Failing to participate in a single battle during a Battle Park Season won't lower your Tamer Rank.
Legendary Tamer Champion Tamer Master Tamer Master Tamer Master Tamer Grand Tamer Grand Tamer Grand Tamer Ace Tamer Ace Tamer Ace Tamer Veteran Tamer Veteran Tamer Veteran Tamer Elite Tamer Elite Tamer Elite Tamer Casual Tamer Casual Tamer Casual Tamer Amateur Tamer Amateur Tamer Amateur Tamer Rookie Tamer Rookie Tamer Rookie Tamer
When the new Season begins, it will restart from the of your held Rank. *When you end the season at Veteran Tamer , the next new Season will restart you at Veteran Tamer . If you are at Legendary Tamer or Champion Tamer, you will restart at Master Tamer .
Battle periods in the Battle Park are called Seasons. The time period and time remaining in a Season can be checked via the top screen of the Battle Park. The totaling period starts from the end of the current Season and lasts until the beginning of the next Season.
Participating in Battle Park battles lets you receive rewards at the start of the next Season. Once the Season is over, going to the Battle Park screen lets you receive rewards corresponding to your Tamer Rank at the time. *You cannot receive rewards for a Battle Park Season you didn't participate in.
Rewards will be given the first time you enter the Battle Park after the next Season begins. *Once you close the screen displaying rewards earned, it cannot be checked again.

In Clash Battles, you work with other Tamers to defeat powerful enemies that appear without warning.
Defeating powerful enemies earns you CB Medals and DGV-Codes needed for Digivolution.

You can only challenge one Clash Battle enemy at a time. *You can challenge any number of times using DigiRubies. Anyone who participated in the Clash Battles will receive rewards. Each Clash Battle is available for 3 hours.
If you have trouble defeating a Clash Battle on your own, try sending out a Support Request. You can see Support Requests made by your Friends and Guild Members in the News section.
In a Clash Battle, you will be rewarded by meeting the following conditions:
- Spotter A reward for players who discover the Clash Battle and joins the raid.
- Supporter A reward for players who join a Clash Battle in response to a Support Request.
- Total Damage Dealt A reward for the top 3 players who dealt the most damage in a successful Clash Battle.
*Be aware that rewards will not be received in the following cases: - If you find a Clash Battle but do not participate in it. - If you dealt no damage to the enemy. - If you quit the Clash Battle halfway.
*Receiving Rewards If you defeat the enemy during your attempt, you may claim your rewards after the battle. If the enemy is defeated on another player's attempt or the Clash Battle ends in failure, you can claim rewards by confirming the result of that battle on the Clash Battle menu's Ended tab.
Every time a Clash Battle enemy is defeated, it becomes stronger. As it gets stronger, the more difficult it is to defeat; however, the rewards becomes more extravagant. On the other hand, if you continue to lose against the Clash Battle enemy, it will become weaker.

Each floor brings the chance of earning rewards to use outside of the Underworld Dungeon by defeating the enemies. Rewards cannot be kept unless all floors are cleared or Return is chosen. The possibility of receiving rare items increases as you progress through the floors.
Team Roster Only Digimon Lv. 99 or higher may attempt the Underworld Dungeon, including Partner Digimon. Battles consist of multiple battles with up to 3 teams (15 Digimon). Each Team's Cost is restricted to 100. A Team must fit within the Team Cost. Each Digimon's Cost is based on its Stage. • 35 Cost: Ultra/Mega • 20 Cost: Armor • 14 Cost: Ultimate • 7 Cost: Champion • 3 Cost: Rookie
Underworld Dungeon Battles Battles in the Underworld Dungeon consist of multiple battles. The following Data will be carried over as each floor is cleared: • HP • CT (Cooldown Time) • Special Gauge
Field Effects Each floor has Field Effects that activate at the beginning of Battle, affecting the Digimon present on the field in various ways. These effects can include Status Abnormalities, Buffs, and Debuffs. Field Effects are dependent on the floor and are not related to the opponent. Field Effects can be counteracted with a Resistance to the effect.
Progressing through the Underworld Dungeon After finishing a floor, you can decide whether to continue or Return. If you continue on to the next floor, you will be prompted to choose one of the teams you created at the beginning of the Dungeon and the next battle will begin. Tap a floor to find more information about it. If you choose Return, you will leave the dungeon immediately and Temporary Items will be acquired permanently. However, you will begin your next attempt at the start of the Underworld Dungeon. Rules may differ depending on the floor you are on. You cannot return to a floor that has already been cleared.
X-Spirals X-Spirals appear on the 16th floor and beyond, and have X-Barriers that reduce all damage. X-Barriers will disappear once the X-Spiral is defeated. Digimon with the X-Antibody skill effect will be able to deal damage without being affected by the X-Barrier.
Rewards Temporary Items can be received at the end of each floor. Because these items have not been permanently received at this point, they cannot be used. Items are acquired permanently after all floors have been cleared, or after Returning. You will be defeated when all your Digimon have fallen. All Temporary Items will be lost.
Rewinding Clock A unique item that can only be used once all your Digimon have fallen. Use the Rewinding Clock to return to the Gear Up screen and retry the floor. Both your team and the enemy Digimon will return to the condition they were in at the moment of floor entry. Return may be chosen at the end of the floor after a Rewinding Clock has been used.
Other The Underworld Dungeon is reset after Returning, Defeat, or clearing all floors. In addition, the organization of floors will also be different in each attempt.

*After beginning the Underworld Dungeon, your partner cannot be changed. Additionally, the following are not available to Digimon in the Dungeon: 　 • Team Edit 　• Skill Upgrade 　• Upgrade/Workout/Awaken/Digivolve/Ascend/Inherit 　• Release 　• Plugin Upgrade/Evolve 　• Equip/Remove Plugins • Selling Equipped Plugins

Enjoy battles within the context of the game's overarching story.
Clearing a Scene unlocks the next Scene.
You can replay a completed Scene as many times as you want.

Make final preparations before a battle at the Gear Up screen, 
such as the Team, your Partner, Care for All, and Backup.

A Tamer can choose one of their Digimon to be their Partner Digimon. The Digimon you select will have the word "Partner" appear on its icon.
A Partner plays a unique role, and shows up as an icon on the Tamer's Profile screen. Bringing your Partner on a Quest lets you use their Special during battle.
A Partner's Bond increases faster than other Digimon. Even if your Partner isn't in a battle, using its Special increases its Bond Points.
Your Partner can be called on by other Tamers as Backup.

Your Team is a group of up to 5 Digimon who accompany you into battle. Teams can be adjusted each time you go on a Quest. You can register up to 3 teams each for Main Story and Battle Park, and Clash Battles.
You can select the Digimon you want to bring to battle with you by tapping the available slot where you can organize and replace Digimon in your team. You can also go to the Equip Plugin screen from here.
When making a Team, only one Digimon with the same Digivolution Chain and Stage can be used at a time.
N/A
N/A

This is a list of all the Digimon and DigiEggs you currently have.
Selecting an icon will show a Digimon's stats.

The Digidex is a comprehensive list of Digimon in the game. You can view a Digimon's detailed profile by tapping on their icon.
Digimon you have not befriended are grayed out and their profiles cannot be viewed.

Releasing a Digimon is a function to part ways with your Digimon Friend. A Digimon that has been released will be gone forever.
When you release a Digimon, you'll receive DigiOrbs in return. The amount of DigiOrbs received will vary for each Digimon.
N/A

Friends are fellow Tamers that you can connect within the game. Friends can provide invaluable support as you play through the game.
The limit on your number of Friends will increase as your Tamer Level increases.
Once you become Friends, you will be able to participate in Rival Battles where you can battle against each other's Battle Park teams. *Users must be able to participate in the Battle Park in order to engage in Rival Battles.
N/A
N/A

Plugins are disks (equipment) inscribed with data used to further draw out a Digimon's potential.
[img width=844 height=325]tutorial/plugin_2[/img]
Place Plugins in your equipment slots to equip them, raising your Digimon's stats and sometimes providing special effects. Each Digimon has a maximum of 6 equipment slots—two each for ATK, DEF and SPE. Not all equipment slots can be used at first, they will slowly unlock as a Digimon Digivolves. All of a Digimon's slots are unlocked when their Bond reaches the maximum of 99.
You can unequip Plugins anytime you want.

- Plugin Upgrade Spend Plugins and bit to increase the Plugin Lv. The amount of Material Plugins and bit needed depends on the Grade (number of stars) of the Base Plugin and number of times upgraded. Plugin Lv. starts from 0, and you can boost it up to +5. If Plugins with the same category (ATK, DEF, or SPE) as the Base Plugin are used, it will be easier to raise its Plugin Lv. Increasing the Plugin Lv. increases the Plugin's stats, which makes your Digimon stronger.
- Plugin Evolve You can use bit to increase the Plugin's Grade by one. The amount of bit needed depends on the current Plugin's Grade you are trying to evolve.
You can evolve Plugins under the following conditions: - Its Plugin Lv. is maxed out. - You have the required amount of bit.
A Plugin's stats increase dramatically when its Grade is raised. Raising the Grade returns its Plugin Lv. to 0. Once a Plugin's Grade has been maxed out, you can no longer evolve the Plugin.
- "Recommended" Function When evolving Plugins, you can automatically select Plugins based on the following criteria: - Same Categories as selected Plugins - Highest Upgrade Pt. - No Personality Restrictions - Rarity 1 - Grade 1 (ATK, DEF) - Grade 3 (SPE) - Plugin Lv. 0 - Unequipped - Unlocked
N/A

DigiWalk counts your steps as you carry your device around, allowing your Partner Digimon to find Care Items or encounter Digimon from other Tamers as you go.
Your pixelated Partner on the DigiWalk screen will travel with you for each step you take. Your Partner's Bond increases when you accept the Care Items your Partner finds, and you can encounter other Digimon along the way.
Changing the date and time or time zone on your device may change or reset your step count. The step count will return to normal once enough time has elapsed for your device's clock to reach the following day. Digimon are encountered in the digital space based on your number of steps, and do not actually reflect people encountered nearby in real life. (Step count info will be stored for 14 days.)

In Care Mode, you can give Care Items to your Digimon to improve their Mood and increase their Bond.
Feeding them a certain amount of Care Items will render your Digimon full and satisfied. They will stop accepting Care Items for a set period.
Select a Digimon while you're in DigiTown. Drag and drop a Care Item from the panel that appears at the bottom-right of the screen.
Requests refer to Digimon wanting certain Care Items. These items appear in a speech bubble above the Digimon. Giving a Digimon the Care Item it requests greatly amplifies the item's effect.
You can Care for your Battle Team by tapping on the "Care for All" button on the Gear Up screen before the start of each battle. You can Care for the entire team all at once, using only as many Care Items as is necessary to reach the maximum Mood level. *If you do not have enough Care Items, Mood will be increased accordingly based on the Care Items consumed.

The Incubator is a device used to hatch DigiEggs. There are two in the center of DigiTown; the Incubator on the left can be used from the beginning. The Incubator on the right is a special Incubator made available when you join a DigiGuild.
- Incubator Selecting an Incubator in DigiTown makes a panel appear containing your DigiEggs. Drag and drop one of your DigiEggs into the Incubator to the start the hatching process. You cannot take out the DigiEgg once the Incubator is activated, and you cannot place another DigiEgg into the Incubator until the Digimon matures to Rookie. The Incubator is powered by bit, and must be injected into the device to use it. The amount of bit required each time and the number of times you need to repeat this process depends on the DigiEgg.
- DigiGuild Incubator Joining a DigiGuild gives you access to an additional Incubator. It functions the same way as a normal Incubator, but using the Request Help function with other DigiGuild members speeds up the hatching process. For more info, check the DigiGuild section.

Guest Digimon are Partner Digimon of other Tamers that can come to hang out in your DigiTown. They have a brown circle at their feet, so you can distinguish them from your own Digimon.
Guest Digimon leave after a set period of time, but others will appear in their place.
Greeting Guest Digimon nets you Social Points.

Select an In-Training I Digimon in DigiTown to check its Digivolution Chain, and the time it requires to Digivolve. The Care Items are stored away on the bottom-right side of the screen. Tap the panel to display the Care Items you currently own. Drag and drop these items to your Digimon to raise their Bond.
Improving Bond and allowing time to pass (a different amount for each In-Training I Digimon) will eventually enable a Digimon to Digivolve.
In-Training I Digimon can only be given In-Training I Care Items. In-Training I Care Items can be found in Quests and on DigiWalk.

You can earn Social Points once a day by greeting Friends.
To greet a friend, tap the Social icon at the top-right of the DigiTown screen, tap Friend, then select a Tamer from your Friend List. You can also greet everyone on your list at once by tapping the Greet All button.
You and your friend earn a Social Point each time you greet each other. Check your Social Points in the Social section of the Present screen from your DigiTown. *You can greet again from [datetime_hour]00:00[/datetime_hour] the next day. *Any Social Points earned after you reach the Social Point Limit (99999) will not be counted.

Members of your DigiGuild can assist you by caring for your DigiEgg and Digimon through the Help function. Help is a function of your DigiGuild, and can be used among DigiGuild Members. The Help function cannot be used if you do not belong to a DigiGuild. You can provide assistance yourself when you receive Requests from other members of your DigiGuild.
A ! mark appears on the Visit button next to a member on the DigiGuild info screen when they ask for Help.
Different effects occur depending on the DigiEgg or Digimon's status. • DigiEgg Reduces required bit or incubation time. • In-Training I or In-Training II Digimon Items can be given to the Digimon similar to normal Care Items. Your Care Items will not be consumed, and you will receive Social Pts.
For DigiEggs, you can reduce required bit or reduce incubation time, but not both. DigiGuild members that provided assistance cannot Help with the same DigiEgg again until the DigiEgg's status changes.

You can check your Digimon Team and their details here.
- Team: Choose which Digimon to take into battle with you. - DigiCare: Choose which Digimon to care for on the DigiTown screen. - Partner Digimon: Choose a Digimon to be your partner.

Training refers to all functions related to a Digimon's growth, including Upgrades and Digivolution.
• Upgrade: 　Level up your Digimon. • Workout / Awakening: 　Train your Digimon, 　or awaken them to increase their level cap. • Digivolve: 　Evolve your Digimon. • Skill Upgrade: 　Raise a Digimon's Skill Level. • Ascend: 　Boost a Supercharged Digimon's Ascension Stage. • Inherit: 　Change a Digimon with a normal Personality into one with a Supercharged Personality by making it inherit 　from a Supercharged Digimon. • Equip Plugins: 　Equip a Digimon with Plugins. • Plugin Upgrade/Evolve: 　Synthesize Plugins to enhance their effects. • Plugins: 　View details on the Plugins you own. • Sell Plugins: 　Sell Plugins for bit and make space in your inventory. • Digimon List: 　View details on the Digimon you own. • Release: 　Release a Digimon and make space in your inventory.

Use all functions related to Plugins, such as equipping and upgrading.
- Equip Plugins: Equip a Digimon with Plugins. - Plugin Upgrade・Evolve: Synthesize Plugins to enhance their effects. - Plugins: View details on the Plugins you own. - Sell Plugins: Sell Plugins for bit and make space in your inventory.
N/A

Use social functions together with other Tamers.
- Friends: 　Check the info of your Friends, 　greet them, accept requests, and more. - DigiGuild: 　Check the info of your DigiGuild Members. -News: 　Show info about other Tamers associated with you.

Quests are opportunities to fight alongside Digimon. You can engage in Quests in the following locations:
- Story: 　Enjoy battles within the context of the game's overarching story. - Dimensional Vortexes: 　Limited-time Quests that change depending on the date or time. - Clash Battles: 　Battles in which you work with other Tamers to defeat a powerful enemy. - Battle Park: 　A place where you can engage in combat with Digimon raised by other Tamers. - Underworld: 　A battle area where you can experience difficult battles.
Locked Quest locations become available as you proceed through the Story.
The Menu allows you to check what items you have, change settings, look at the Help section, send inquiries, or transfer your account data.

Decorations are items that you can place to decorate your DigiTown. To place a Decoration, tap the Deco button while in your DigiTown. To place a Decoration, drag and drop one from the list. Decorations that have already been placed can be moved, rotated, or returned to your Storage. The buttons in the top right of the screen allow you to sell Decorations or increase your storage limit.
You can also move a Decoration if you tap and hold it while in your DigiTown.
N/A

You can send Friend Requests to other Tamers. You become Friends when the other Tamer accepts your Friend Request.
Examples of Request Recipients: 1. To Backup on Battle Results screen. 2. To Tamers you fought against in the Battle Park. 3. To other Tamers when you visit their DigiTown. Details on Friend Requests can be found in Sent section under Friends on the Social screen. Friend Requests do not expire. Up to 30 Friend Requests can be pending at a time. The earliest Friend Request will be deleted when the 31st Friend Request is sent.

Missions are goals that earn rewards when achieved. A notification is displayed on-screen when a Mission is accomplished. There are 4 types of Missions:
- Daily Missions New missions assigned every day. Relatively simple objectives, and a bonus Completion Reward is given for accomplishing all of them. - Weekly Mission New missions assigned every week. These are more difficult than Daily Missions, but completing the whole thing nets you a bonus Completion Reward. - Totals Missions Missions that count totals tallied from when you first started playing the game. Many of these missions require time to complete. - Special Missions 　Missions activated by specific events. Once all objectives are completed such missions are no longer displayed.
Actions taken during the tutorial phase are not tallied.

You can spend DigiRubies or Social Pts. to obtain Digimon and Plugins. There are two major categories of Summons: Digimon Summon or Plugin Summon. There is also Step-Up Summon whose drop rates change depending on how many times used and can give bonuses. The Summon Rates tab displays available Digimon and Plugins and their respective summon rates.
Available Summons vary depending on current events or campaigns.
You can get your hands on DigiDiamonds through certain Summons. Requirements for obtaining DigiDiamonds can be found in the Notice.
N/A

The Item List is used to check items you have possession of outside of Digimon, Plugins, Decorations and DigiEggs, such as:
- Care Items - Workout Items - DGV-Codes - Super Awakening Item - Skill Stones - Other (Stamina Recovery drinks, Vortex Keys, etc.)
N/A

The Help section contains info on gameplay features separated into categories.
If reading the Help section does not resolve your issue, please contact us via Inquiries in the Menu.
Settings is where you can adjust your sound and Push Notifications.

You can sell Decorations to get rid of ones that you no
longer need. Some Decorations cannot be sold.

Scene Select lets you browse scenes that play during Quests in the Story. You can also view the opening movie, Digivolution scenes and more.
Watching a scene once records it in the Scene Select section.
Scene Select can be accessed by tapping the Menu button at the top-right of the DigiTown screen, then Scene Select.
*Rankings will be displayed after all results have been totaled. *Rankings of events you did not participate in or did not rank in will not be displayed.

Challenges are special events held for a limited time. Earn rewards by successfully completing requests from other Digimon. Complete all requests to earn a special Completion Reward.
Challenges with time limits will end when the designated period is over. After fulfilling the required conditions, you must claim your reward within this period. Some Challenges end as soon as you receive all of the rewards. Completed Challenges automatically disappear from the list.

Accepting Friend Requests from other Tamers will make you friends with them.
To review the Friend Requests sent to you, tap Social in the top-right of your DigiTown, go to the Friends screen, and check the Pending section.
Friend Requests do not expire. Up to 30 Friend Requests can be pending at a time. The oldest Friend Request will be deleted when the 31st Friend Request is received.

Raid Clash Battles are battles available for a limited period of time where you team up with other Tamers to take on a powerful foe.
You will gain Raid Points (Pt.) if you join a Raid Clash Battle and successfully defeat the foe. You can also gain Personal Raid Pt. depending on how many Raid Pt. you have earned.
Moreover, having a BON Digimon in your team when you defeat the foe will earn you extra Raid Pt.
Generally, BON Digimon will have higher stats than usual during a Raid Clash Battle. You can find out which Digimon will have a BON effect by checking the Notices for the event.

Defeating a foe during a Raid Clash Battle will earn you Raid Pt. You can claim an exclusive reward based on the amount of Raid Pt acquired.
・Global Raid Pt. Reward A reward based on the total Raid Points collected by all users.
・Personal Raid Pt. Reward A reward based on your individual Raid Points earned.
Note: You cannot receive rewards for the following: -Discovering the foe without joining the Raid Clash Battle -Dealing no damage to the foe -Withdrawing mid-battle -Failing a raid
*Info on Total Raid Points can be found by going to the main screen. *Get the latest info by refreshing the Raid Clash Battle main screen.

Clash Battle Search enables you to battle against a formidable opponent from a previous Clash Battle.
Using the search costs Stamina.
Each opponent will have a specific level; beginning from Lv. 1, you will have to defeat each opponent in order to challenge the next one.
A First Time Clear Reward can be claimed each time you clear a level for the first time.

Spotlight Digimon Quest (SDQ) is an event where original stories focusing on <color=#e75600>Assist Digimon </color>unfold.
Stamina is required to progress through the stories.
During a Quest, <color=#e75600>Assist Digimon</color> will join your team and fight battles with you.
Multiple acts are available. Complete the objectives of an act to unlock the next.
You will earn <color=#e75600>Spotlight Pts.</color> every time you clear a Quest, and you can use those points for the Limited Summon.

- Time Period Spotlight Digimon Quest will be available for a limited time. Quests cannot be attempted after the time period has ended.
- Event Team Your team for the Spotlight Digimon Quests.
- Assist Digimon Digimon that join your team and can be used in battles during the event. Assist Digimon will be automatically added to your team until you clear the designated Quests. Upon clearing the requirements, you will receive the Assist Digimon, and you will once again be able to freely train and organize your team.
- Spotlight Pts. Gain Spotlight Pts by clearing Quests. Spotlight Pts. can be used for this quest-specific Limited Summon.
- Spotlight Digimon Quest Limited Summon Limited Summon that can be used by spending Spotlight Pts. You can get a variety of useful items from this Summon.
- Scene Select You can view scenarios from Spotlight Digimon Quests. Scenarios will be added to Scene Select after viewing them once.
*If the requirements are not fulfilled by the end of the time period, you will no longer be able to befriend the Assist Digimon. *Until the designated requirements have been met, Assist Digimon cannot do the following: - Equip Plugins. - Be placed in DigiCare. *Once the Reward Claim Period has ended, you can no longer use your Spotlight Pts. *Spotlight Pts. will not be transferred to future Spotlight Digimon Quests. *Requirements for receiving Assist Digimon are different for each Spotlight Digimon Quest.

Battle Park is a place where players can battle with other players' teams. Use exclusive BP Stamina to join the Battle Park. BP Stamina will automatically recover over time.
The team that annihilates the opposing team first wins the battle. There is a time limit, and once the time is up, the team with the higher combined HP remaining wins the battle.
BP Pointscan be obtained after winning the battle. BP Points reset each Season and is divided into two types: Season BP Pointsand Total BP Points accumulated throughout the season. By accumulating BP Points, your rank and your rankings will go up. Furthermore, depending on your actions and the conditions at the time of the victory, Bonus BP Points may be awarded.
[Victory] • Victory: Points added upon victory. • Crushing Victory Bonus: Points added if no one on the team has been defeated. • Narrow Victory Bonus: Points added if only 1 member of the team has survived. • Maximum Damage Bonus: Points added when a member from the player's team has dealt the most damage during battle. • First Knockdown Bonus: Points added when a member from the player's team defeats the other team's member first.

[Defeat] • Defeat: In the event of a loss, you will lose points in the Master League, but no points will be decreased or added in the Normal League. • Close Match Bonus: Points added when 4 enemies are defeated. Points will not be added if 3 or less enemies are defeated. • Maximum Damage Bonus: Points added when a member from the player's team has dealt the most damage during battle. • First Knockdown Bonus: Points added when a member from the player's team defeats the other team's member first.
A condition that increases a Digimon's Stats (HP, PWR/TEC, DEF, SPD). A Boost effect will be activated during battle under certain conditions. Boosts come in the following types: • Personality Boost A Boost that will be applied to Digimon depending on their Personality. When Personality Boost has been activated, the Digimon's icon will be highlighted with a red frame. • Limited Boost A Boost that will be applied to specific Digimon. When Limited Boost has been activated, the specified Digimon's icon will display an arrow. The more arrows, the greater the effect.
*Personality Boost and Limited Boost effects can be stacked.

Battle periods in the Battle Park are called Seasons. The time period and time remaining in a Season can be checked via the top screen of the Battle Park. The totaling period starts from the end of the current Season and lasts until the beginning of the next Season. Once the Season is over, players will receive rewards corresponding to their Ranks and respective League Rankings. Please refer to Battle Park Ranks for more information.

When joining the Battle Park, a rank is assigned to the players. Players will start from the lowest rank - Rank J.
Rank depends on the total number of BP points. Players must win a Promotion Battle in order to increase their rank. Promotion Battles will begin by accumulating the BP Points decided for each rank. A rank will not drop once you are promoted.
There are 11 ranks in total, and the higher you go up on the list, the higher the rank. Rank S Rank A Rank B Rank C Rank D Rank E Rank F Rank G Rank H Rank I Rank J
There are two leagues in the Battle Park, and players will be divided into either the Master League or Normal League at the end of each Season. The Master League is where the top Rank S players battle, while the rest of the players are matched up against each other in the Normal League.
• Players will be placed in each league according to the ranking results at the end of the Season. Those who placed 1st to 200th place in the Master League will remain in the Master League. Those who placed 201th place and lower in the Master League will be switched out with those who ranked in the top 300 in the Normal League. •At Rank S, you can choose between possible candidates for battle. The BP Points you receive will increase or decrease depending on the strength of your opponents. •In the Master League, your BP Points will be decreased as a penalty if you lose or quit.

Rewards Players can earn Season Rewards and extraordinary rewards by participating in the Battle Park.
• Rank Rewards: Rewards will be given out at the end of the season based on each player's rank. The higher the rank, the better the rewards. • Ranking Rewards: Rewards will be based on the rankings of all users. Rewards will vary depending on the league you are participating in. The more BP Points you accumulate, the higher the rank.
Rewards are given out every time a player gets a promotion.
Rewards can be earned based on the number of battles players participate in. Daily Bonuses will reset each day. BP Stamina will be used to participate in battles regardless of the battle results.
*Season Rewards can be claimed when visiting the Battle Park screen the following season. *Players cannot claim Season Rewards unless they have participated in Battle Park. *The Claim Rewards screen cannot be accessed again once it is closed. *Use DigiRubies to recover the maximum amount of BP Stamina. *Unlike in Quest Mode, Specials cannot be used in the Battle Park. *The maximum BP Point is 999999999. *Rankings are updated once every hour. *In cases where multiple players have accumulated the same number of points, the player who achieved that number first will be ranked higher. *"Season Information" on the Battle Achievement screen will be updated each Season.

1周年激突戦イベントとは、他のテイマーたちと協力して、期間中に出現した強敵と戦うバトルです。
イベント期間中、激突戦に参加し、討伐が成功するたびに1周年pt（1しゅうねんポイント）が蓄積されます。 獲得した1周年ptに応じて「個人1周年pt報酬」を受け取ることができます。 さらに、ユーザー全体の1周年ptの合計に応じた「全体1周年pt報酬」を受け取ることができます。
また、強敵に対して、特効ボーナスが発生するデジモンをチームに編成して討伐することで、通常よりも多くptを得ることができます。
特効ボーナス対象のデジモンは、1周年激突戦イベントのバトル中、基本ステータスがアップします。 特効ボーナス対象のデジモンは、開催中イベントのお知らせから確認することができます。

masterRows.title_text: 1周年激突戦イベントのルール
masterRows.detail_text:
1周年激突戦イベント期間中に、激突戦の強敵を倒すことで1周年pt（1しゅうねんポイント）の獲得と、1周年ptに応じた報酬を受け取ることができます。
・全体1周年pt報酬 　全ユーザーの1周年ptの合計に応じて受け取ることができる 　報酬です。
・個人1周年pt報酬 　個人の1周年ptに応じて受け取ることができる報酬です。
※以下の場合はポイントを獲得できませんのでご注意ください。 ・発見しただけで、討伐に参加しなかった場合 ・強敵にダメージを与えられなかった場合 ・途中でリタイアした場合 ・討伐に失敗した場合
※1周年激突戦イベントにおいて、イベントTOP画面に表示されている全体1周年pt報酬の情報は、イベントTOP画面に遷移した時点の情報を表示しています。 ※イベントTOP画面に入り直すことで最新の情報に更新されます。

You can search for specific Tamers in the game. Each Tamer is provided with a unique ID. You can send Friend Requests to specific Tamers by searching for their ID.
Your own ID can be seen at the Friend Search screen and Profile screen.
You can search for Friends using the Friend Search function under Friends on the Social screen, which is accessible from the top-right of your DigiTown.

Each floor brings the chance of earning rewards to use outside of the Underworld Dungeon by defeating the enemies. Rewards cannot be kept unless all floors are cleared or Return is chosen. The possibility of receiving rare items increases as you progress through the floors.
Team Roster Only Digimon Lv. 99 or higher may attempt the Underworld Dungeon, including Partner Digimon. Battles consist of multiple battles with up to 3 teams (15 Digimon). Each Team's Cost is restricted to 100. A Team must fit within the Team Cost. Each Digimon's Cost is based on its Stage. • 35 Cost: Ultra/Mega • 20 Cost: Armor • 14 Cost: Ultimate • 7 Cost: Champion • 3 Cost: Rookie
Underworld Dungeon Battles Battles in the Underworld Dungeon consist of multiple battles. The following Data will be carried over as each floor is cleared: • HP • CT (Cooldown Time) • Special Gauge
Field Effects Each floor has Field Effects that activate at the beginning of Battle, affecting the Digimon present on the field in various ways. These effects can include Status Abnormalities, Buffs, and Debuffs. Field Effects are dependent on the floor and are not related to the opponent. Field Effects can be counteracted with a Resistance to the effect.
Progressing through the Underworld Dungeon After finishing a floor, you can decide whether to continue or Return. If you continue on to the next floor, you will be prompted to choose one of the teams you created at the beginning of the Dungeon and the next battle will begin. Tap a floor to find more information about it. If you choose Return, you will leave the dungeon immediately and Temporary Items will be acquired permanently. However, you will begin your next attempt at the start of the Underworld Dungeon. Rules may differ depending on the floor you are on. You cannot return to a floor that has already been cleared.
X-Spirals X-Spirals appear on the 16th floor and beyond, and have X-Barriers that reduce all damage. X-Barriers will disappear once the X-Spiral is defeated. Digimon with the X-Antibody skill effect will be able to deal damage without being affected by the X-Barrier.
Rewards Temporary Items can be received at the end of each floor. Because these items have not been permanently received at this point, they cannot be used. Items are acquired permanently after all floors have been cleared, or after Returning. You will be defeated when all your Digimon have fallen. All Temporary Items will be lost.
Rewinding Clock A unique item that can only be used once all your Digimon have fallen. Use the Rewinding Clock to return to the Gear Up screen and retry the floor. Both your team and the enemy Digimon will return to the condition they were in at the moment of floor entry. Return may be chosen at the end of the floor after a Rewinding Clock has been used.
Other The Underworld Dungeon is reset after Returning, Defeat, or clearing all floors. In addition, the organization of floors will also be different in each attempt.

*After beginning the Underworld Dungeon, your Partner cannot be changed. Additionally, the following are not available to Digimon in the Dungeon: 　 • Team Edit 　• Skill Upgrade 　• Upgrade/Workout/Awaken/Digivolve/Ascend/Inherit 　• Release 　• Plugin Upgrade/Evolve 　• Equip/Remove Plugins • Selling Equipped Plugins

A unique item that can only be used once all your Digimon have fallen. 
 Use the Rewinding Clock to return to the Gear Up screen and retry the floor.
 Both your team and the enemy Digimon will return to the condition they were in at the moment of floor entry.
Return may be chosen at the end of the floor after a Rewinding Clock has been used.

Only Digimon Lv. 99 or higher may attempt the Underworld Dungeon, including Partner Digimon.
 Battles consist of multiple battles with up to 3 teams (15 Digimon).
 A Team's Cost is restricted to 100. 
 A Team must fit within the Team Cost. 
 Each Digimon's Cost is based on its Stage.
 - 35 Cost: Ultra/Mega 
 - 20 Cost: Armor
 - 14 Cost: Ultimate
 - 7 Cost: Champion
- 3 Cost: Rookie

Make final preparations before a battle at the Gear Up screen, 
such as the Team, your Partner, Care for All, and Backup.
*Cannot call for Backup in the Underworld.

Different rankings will be available for Raid Pts. obtained during Clash Battles and number of defeated enemies. It will be possible to check your individual and DigiGuild rankings.
Types of Rankings • Raid Pt. Ranking This ranking is based on Raid Pts. obtained.
• Giant Spiral - Number Defeated Ranking This ranking is based on the number of Giant Spirals defeated. (The number defeated will only be added up until Rank 3.) (You must defeat the Giant Spirals at least once.)
• Giant Spiral - Damage Ranking This ranking is based on the amount of damage dealt to Giant Spirals during a battle. (Even if more damage is dealt than the Giant Spirals' total HP in the final blow, 　calculated damage for the ranking will be equivalent to the remaining HP.) (Only applicable to individual rankings.)
Conditions for DigiGuild Ranking Rewards You must accumulate at least 1 point in a qualifying Clash Battle while in a DigiGuild.
• Raid Pt. Ranking This ranking is based on Raid Pts. obtained. (You must participate in a Raid at least once.)
• Giant Spiral - Number Defeated Ranking This ranking is based on the number of Giant Spirals defeated. (The number defeated will only be added up until Rank 3.) (You must defeat the Giant Spirals at least once.)
Ranking Period Ranking Period will be divided into Part One and Part Two. In addition, there will also be a Total ranking that combines both parts.
*Ranking displayed during the event will be updated once every 30 minutes. *Cannot check Part Two Rankings while Part One Rankings are being tallied.

You can receive rewards based on your ranking in each category. There is a tallying period for each category of ranking. During the tallying period, information on the ranking cannot be accessed. Final results will be displayed once the tallying is complete.
(Any user who participates in any unacceptable activities such as cheating during the tallying period will be excluded from ranking.) (Part Two Rankings cannot be checked while Part One Rankings are being tallied.)

Use Workout Chips to train and strengthen your Digimon. There are 6 types of training exercises available to strengthen your Digimon, each of which requires a certain type of Chip. Workouts increase a Digimon's Stats. The type of Chip consumed differs according to the Digimon's Personality and Stage.
You can awaken your Digimon once you've cleared all six workout exercises, increasing their Stats and level cap. Awakening consumes bit, the amount of which varies depending on the Stage of your Digimon.
Super Awaken Digimon with the required items to raise a Digimon's level cap to 100 and above. The type and number of items required for Super Awakening differs according to the Digimon's Personality and Stage.

You can have a mock battle with your friends and DigiGuild members.
Choose one of your Battle Park teams to battle against the last team your opponent used in the Battle Park.
*Both users must be able to participate in the Battle Park in order to have a Rival Battle. *Results of the battle will not affect your Battle Achievements.

You can unfriend a Tamer through the Remove Friends function. Use this function if you want to free up space in your Friends list to add new Friends after you reach your limit.
Go to Friends in the Social screen accessible from the top-right of your DigiTown, then tap the "Cancel" button next to the appropriate Friend within the Friends List.

Raging Raid Battle! is a battle available for a limited period of time where you team up with other Tamers to take on a powerful foe.
Raging Raid Battle! Rules Team up with your Partner Digimon and other Tamers' Partner Digimon to fight battles. All Tamers that participate and win the battle within the time limit will get Raid rewards! Specials cannot be used during battle.
There are multiple difficulty levels. Clearing one level will unlock the next. Once you have cleared a difficulty level, you cannot select it again. However, the levels can be restarted from easy once a day at a predetermined time.
Team Teams are composed of your Partner Digimon and five other Partner Digimon. Your team can have Digimon of the same Personality and Digivolution Chain.
Rewards Each difficulty level allows you to earn different rewards. Furthermore, the rewards will be sent to the befriended Tamer's Present Box.

Teams are composed of your Partner Digimon and five other Partner Digimon. Your team can have Digimon of the same Personality and Digivolution Chain. You can add or remove another Tamer's Digimon to your team by tapping on them.
You can see details about your befriended Tamer's Partner on the Gearing Up screen. The Gearing Up screen will not be updated with new Partner information until the Raging Raid Battle! has been challenged at least once.

A DigiGuild is a community composed of Tamers. All members of the DigiGuild can enjoy benefits through cooperation.
Each DigiGuild has a single Leader, and all other Tamers within the DigiGuild are Members. One Subleader can be appointed from among the Members. A DigiGuild can have a maximum of 40 members, including a Leader.
To be associated with a DigiGuild, either create one yourself as a Leader, or join another Tamer's DigiGuild.
Once you are a member of a DigiGuild, you will be able to participate in Rival Battles where you can battle against other members' Battle Park teams. *Users must be able to participate in the Battle Park in order to engage in Rival Battles.
You must reach a certain point in the Story to be associated with a DigiGuild.

Clash Battle Events are battles available for a limited period of time where you team up with other Tamers to take on a powerful foe.
You will gain Raid Points (Pt.) if you join a Clash Battle and successfully defeat the foe during the event. You can also gain Personal Raid Pt. depending on how many Raid Pt. you have earned. Furthermore, you can gain Global Raid Pt. Rewards based on the total Raid Points collected by all users.
Moreover, having a BON Digimon in your team when you defeat the foe will earn you extra points.
Generally, BON Digimon will have higher stats than usual during a Clash Battle Event. You can find out which Digimon will have a BON effect by checking the Notices for the event.

Defeating a foe during a Raid Clash Battle will earn you Raid Pt. You can claim an exclusive reward based on the amount of Raid Pt acquired.
- Global Raid Pt. Reward A reward based on the total Raid Points collected by all users.
- Personal Raid Pt. Reward A reward based on your individual Raid Points earned.
*You cannot receive rewards for the following: - If you find a Clash Battle but do not participate in it. - If you dealt no damage to the enemy. - If you quit the Clash Battle halfway. - If you fail a raid.
*Raids that have expired will be treated as unconquered. *During the Clash Battle Event, the details of the Global Raid Pt. Rewards displayed on the Event Top screen is the information at the time of access. *Get the latest info by refreshing the Event Top screen.

[Battle Challenge Rules] Form a team with only your Digimon and fight against bosses. You will not be able to call for Backup during this time. Event Pts. can be obtained by defeating enemies. You will not be able to use Specials because of this location. You will not be able to continue the battle if you lose.
[Difficulty] There are many difficulty levels, and clearing one difficulty level will unlock the next.
[Boost Effects] Adding certain Digimon to your team can increase Event Pts. and Stats. You can check the event notices for more information about applicable Digimon.
[Clear Rewards] These rewards can be obtained by successfully defeating bosses. Different amounts of Event Pts. can be obtained based on the difficulty level. There is also a chance of obtaining Unique Plugins and Event-only Digimon.
[Event Pt. Rewards] These rewards can be obtained after a certain amount of Event Pts. have been accumulated. Tap the Claim button located on the Event Top screen to receive your reward.

Battle Challenge is a battle in which players fight against bosses that appear during the event period with their own Digimon.
During the event period, players can collect Event Pts. and receive rewards with those Pts.
For more details, please tap the Rules button located on the Event Top screen.

Ascension raises the Ascension Stage of Digimon with Supercharged Personalities, allowing you to raise your Digimon's maximum Stats and Skill levels. There are up to 4 Ascension Stages.
Ascension consumes bit.
*You must have more than one Digimon of the same Chain with a Supercharged Personality. *You cannot ascend a Digimon already in a team. However, you can ascend a Base Digimon. *Digimon must be level 99 or above. *Digimon selected as a Partner, in a team, locked, or under care cannot be used as Ascension materials.

You can use Digimon with Supercharged Personalities as combining material to pass on abilities to Digimon with normal personalities. Inheritance will result in a higher level, bond, and skill level, turning your Digimon into one with a Supercharged Personality.
By undergoing Inheritance and having your Digimon turn into one with a Supercharged Personality, your Digimon will be much strengthened. You will lose the original Digimon with a Supercharged Personality that was used for the Inheritance.
*You must have at least one Digimon with a normal Personality and one with a Supercharged Personality to perform an Inheritance. The Digimon must be at least level 99 or above. *The level, skill level, or bond of the Digimon with the normal personality must be higher than that of the Digimon with Supercharged Personality. *Digimon selected as a Partner, in a team, locked, or under care cannot be used as Inheritance materials.

The Clash Battle! Event consists of battles available for a limited period of time where you team up with other Tamers to take on a powerful foe.
You will gain Raid Points (Pts.) if you join a Clash Battle and successfully defeat a specific powerful enemy during the event. You can also gain Personal Raid Pt. Rewards depending on how many Raid Pts. you have earned. Furthermore, you can gain Global Raid Pt. Rewards based on the total Raid Points collected by all users.
Having a BON Digimon in your team when you defeat the enemy will earn you extra points.
You can also get Ranking Rewards by participating in rankings based on Raid Pts. obtained during the event period, the number of specific powerful enemies defeated, and the maximum damage inflicted on those enemies.
Generally, BON Digimon will have higher stats than usual during a Clash Battle! Event. You can find out which Digimon will have a BON effect by checking the Notices for the event.
For more details, please tap the Rules button located on the Event Top screen.

Defeating a foe during a Clash Battle Event will earn you Raid Pts. You can claim an exclusive reward based on the amount of Raid Pt. acquired.
• Global Raid Pt. Reward A reward based on the total Raid Points collected by all users.
• Personal Raid Pt. Reward A reward based on your individual Raid Points earned.
In addition, you can participate in various rankings by fighting powerful enemies that appear during the event period. You can receive rewards according to your rank in each ranking category.
• Individual Raid Pt. Ranking, DigiGuild Raid Pt. Ranking Rankings based on the total number of Raid Pts. earned by defeating a specific enemy. There are three rankings: Part One, Part Two, and Total.
• Individual Number Defeated Ranking, DigiGuild Number Defeated Ranking Rankings based on the total number of Giant Spirals defeated. There are three rankings: Part One, Part Two, and Total.
• Damage Ranking Rankings based on the total damage dealt to Giant Spirals (Lv. 20) in a single battle. There is a Total ranking.
*You cannot receive Raid Pts. for the following: • If you find a Clash Battle but do not participate in it. • If you dealt no damage to the enemy. • If you quit the Clash Battle halfway. • If you fail a raid. *Raids that have expired will be treated as unconquered. *During the Clash Battle Event, the details of the Global Raid Pt. Rewards displayed on the Event Top screen is the information at the time of access. *Get the latest info by refreshing the Event Top screen. *The Raid Pts. earned in a previous event are not transferred to this event. *The total damage inflicted in one battle will be used as your Damage Ranking. If you use DigiRubies to retry the battle, the restarted battle will count as one battle. The total damage you inflict during the retry will not be added to your damage from the previous battle. *DigiGuild rankings for both Raid Pt. and Number Defeated are calculated from the total Raid Pts. collected and overall number of Giant Spirals defeated by your entire DigiGuild. *You must be part of a DigiGuild and obtain at least 1 Pt. from defeating a powerful enemy in order to get rewards for DigiGuild Raid Pt. Ranking. *You must be part of a DigiGuild and defeat at least one Giant Spiral while being one of the top three to deal damage to get rewards for DigiGuild Number Defeated Ranking. *DigiGuild Ranking Placement Rewards will be your DigiGuild's Placement Rewards after the end of the event. *If you disband your DigiGuild after rankings are calculated, your former DigiGuild won't be displayed in Rankings, but you will still receive the rewards you secured at the time of calculation.

You can create your own DigiGuild and become its Leader.
Input Name of DigiGuild, Crest, description, privacy settings, and other required information. Names already claimed by other DigiGuilds cannot be used. bit is required to create a DigiGuild.
To establish a DigiGuild, tap Create under DigiGuild on the Social screen, which is accessible from the top-right of your DigiTown.
Play through the Main Story to unlock the DigiGuild function.

Levels indicate a Digimon's strength. Spending bit in Upgrade will level up your Digimon, which makes them stronger and increases their stats.
Once a Digimon reaches its maximum level, it will no longer be able to level up. You can raise a Digimon's maximum level through Awakening or Digivolution.

DigiGuild Search lets you find specific DigiGuilds by name, or suggests DigiGuilds to you.
To use the DigiGuild Search, tap the Social icon at the top-right of the DigiTown screen, then go to the DigiGuild screen and select the DigiGuild Search tab.

After displaying the DigiGuild list, tap the Join button to send a request to the DigiGuild.
DigiGuilds are either Private, requiring their Leader to accept your request, or Public, allowing you to join the DigiGuild immediately as long as the Member limit has not been reached. You may send Join requests to multiple DigiGuilds at a time, and the status of your requests can be seen under Sent.
Join requests expire after 1 week. Up to 10 requests can be sent at a time. The oldest request will be deleted after an 11th request is sent. *You cannot leave a DigiGuild within the first 24 hours after joining it.

Leaders may edit their DigiGuild's description, accept Join requests, and remove Members from the DigiGuild. The Manage button will be displayed for Leaders and Subleaders on the DigiGuild Info screen.
Leaders may appoint a Subleader from their Member ranks to assist in DigiGuild management. Subleaders basically have the same privileges as the Leader, and their role is to help manage the guild.
Leaders may not leave the DigiGuild unless they appoint another Member to be Leader in their place. If the Leader is the only Member, the DigiGuild can be disbanded. Subleaders may leave without restriction, and can also revert to being a regular Member.
If the Leader does not log in for 30 days or longer, the Subleader automatically becomes the Leader and the former Leader will become a regular DigiGuild Member. If a Subleader has not been named, a new Leader will be chosen from among the regular DigiGuild Members with the fewest login days.

You can support other DigiGuild Members by sending them bit, which in turn recovers your Stamina (even beyond its limit) for each Member you support.
Tap the Support button next to the corresponding Member in the DigiGuild Info screen to offer your support. Tap the Support All button to send bit to every Member of the DigiGuild at once.
Support will be unavailable for a short period of time after doing so.
Members can receive their bit from the Social tab under Present on the DigiTown screen.

Once a day, you can tap the Check-In button to declare your attendance. Total guild attendance is calculated daily, and rewards corresponding to the number of daily Member reports are distributed the next day to all Members of your DigiGuild. Better rewards are given if more Members report in. Attendance of Members that leave the DigiGuild are not counted. Tap the Claim button to receive your reward.
A day in the game is calculated as [datetime_hour]00:00[/datetime_hour] to [datetime_hour]23:59[/datetime_hour] of the next day.

Joining a DigiGuild gives you access to an additional Incubator. It has the same functions as the first Incubator, but is adorned with your DigiGuild's Crest.
You will lose access to this Incubator if you leave the DigiGuild. This special type of Incubator can be used again if you rejoin a DigiGuild, or join another DigiGuild.
The state of the DigiGuild Incubator changes depending on state of the DigiEgg or Digimon when you leave a DigiGuild. -Leaving the DigiGuild with a DigiEgg in the Incubator The DigiGuild Incubator becomes unusable with the DigiEgg still set inside. You can neither remove nor hatch the DigiEgg. -Leaving the DigiGuild with an In-Training I or In-Training II Digimon in the Incubator You can continue to care for the Digimon, but once they Digivolve to Rookie, the DigiGuild Incubator will be unusable until you rejoin a DigiGuild.

Members of your DigiGuild can assist you by caring for your DigiEgg and Digimon through the Help function. You can provide assistance yourself when you receive Requests from other members of your DigiGuild.
A ! mark appears on the Visit button next to a member on the DigiGuild info screen when they ask for Help.
Different effects occur depending on the DigiEgg or Digimon's status. • DigiEgg Reduces required bit or incubation time. • In-Training I or In-Training II Digimon Items can be given to the Digimon similar to normal Care Items. Your Care Items will not be consumed, and you will receive Social Pts.
For DigiEggs, you can reduce required bit or reduce incubation time, but not both. DigiGuild members that provided assistance cannot Help with the same DigiEgg again until the DigiEgg's status changes.

Here are the ways you can help other Guild Members:
- Requesting Help DigiEggs Select the DigiGuild Incubator and tap the Request Help button. In-Training Digimon Select the In-Training II Digimon that hatched from the DigiGuild Incubator and tap the Request Help button.
- Offering Help From the DigiGuild Info screen, tap the Visit button with a ! mark next to a DigiGuild Member to visit their DigiTown. You can help with an Incubator with a ! mark over it, or an In-Training II Digimon with a Request bubble over them.
Helping will not consume your bit or Care Items. In-Training I or In-Training II Digimon require exclusive items to assist in caring for them. An exclusive help item is distributed to players when they assist.

The DigiGuild Log records Member activities related to
the DigiGuild, such as joining, leaving, checking in, and offering support.

The Leave DigiGuild option allows you to leave a DigiGuild. Leaving a DigiGuild disables your DigiGuild Incubator, and you cannot join another DigiGuild for 24 hours.
To leave a DigiGuild, tap the Leave button found in the DigiGuild Info tab on the DigiGuild screen, which is accessible after tapping the Social icon at the top-right of your DigiTown.

A Digimon's Mood has three levels: Superb, Good, Normal.
The better their mood, the higher their Critical Rate. A higher Mood Bonus lets you acquire more items during a Quest.
A Digimon's Mood will drop over time, but you can raise it back up in Care Mode.

News displays activities concerning you by other Tamers.
- Footprint A record of Guest Digimon that have visited your DigiTown. - Backup A record of who has assisted you in previous battles. - Friends A record of Friend Requests sent and accepted. - Greetings A record of Greetings sent by friends. - DigiGuild A record of Support and Help requests in your DigiGuild. - Clash Battles A record of Support Requests.

You can befriend new Digimon by using the Digimon Summons. DigiRubies are consumed to activate each Summon. Different sets of Digimon are available for different Summons. Available Digimon and their Summon rates are listed under the Summon Rates tab.
There are two types of Summons: Summon, where you can gain one new Digimon, and 10+1 Summon, which provides a total of 11 new Digimon.
You can get your hands on DigiDiamonds through certain Summons. Requirements for obtaining DigiDiamonds can be found in the Notice.

You can gain new Plugins by using the Plugin Summons. Summons can require either DigiRubies or Social Points to activate. Different sets of Plugins are available for different Summons. Available Plugins and their Summon rates are listed under the Summon Ratio tab.
There are two types of Summons: 1x Summon, where you can gain one new Plugin, and 10 Summon +1, which provides a bonus Plugin for a total of 11 new Plugins.

DigiWalk counts your steps as you carry your device around, allowing your Partner Digimon to find Care Items or encounter Digimon from other Tamers as you go.
Your pixelated Partner on the DigiWalk screen will travel with you for each step you take. Your Partner's Bond increases when you accept the Care Items your Partner finds, and you can encounter other Digimon along the way.
Tap the DigiWalk icon in the top-right of your DigiTown to see the DigiWalk screen.
Transferring your account (switching devices) while DigiWalk is active will reset the steps accumulated up to that point. If you transfer your account, the DigiWalk icon in the top-right of your DigiTown must be tapped again to restart the step-counting process. Changing the date and time or time zone on your device may change or reset your step count. The step count will return to normal once enough time has elapsed for your device's clock to reach the following day. The app does not need to be open for DigiWalk to remain active. Digimon are encountered in the digital space based on your number of steps, and do not actually reflect people encountered nearby in real life. (Step count info will be stored for 14 days.)

When activating DigiWalk for the first time, a pop-up will request permission for Step Acquisition. DigiWalk cannot be used until this permission is granted. DigiWalk cannot be used on devices without a pedometer function.
If you deny permission for Step Acquisition, this setting can be changed from your device's settings menu. Please refer to your device's user manual for details on how to access your permission settings.

There are 4 aspects to the DigiWalk feature:
- Receive Items 　Obtain items found by your Partner. - Encounter Tamers 　Acquire Social Points and details on encountered Tamers. - Customize 　Change the design of your DigiWalk screen. - Refresh 　Refresh information displayed on-screen.
With DigiWalk, your Partner Digimon finds Care Items along the way, and you gain Social Points for crossing paths with other Tamers.

A <color=#e75600>pedometer function</color> is required for DigiWalk.
Please refer to your device's user manual for details on how to access your permission settings.

The Widget function displays information about the app on your device's home screen. You can check your Partner Digimon's status without opening the app itself. [img width=844 height=325]tutorial/widget_1[/img]
Your Partner Digimon's Request and other info will be displayed.

[iOS]The way to equip the widget differs depending on the device.
Go to the iOS home screen and swipe it to the right to access the widget menu. Scroll to the bottom of the page and tap Edit. Tap the + icon on the Digimon ReArise widget to add it. After adding the widget, tap Done in the upper-right corner to close the settings menu. To remove the widget, tap the - icon and select Remove.
Functions may differ depending on the device used. Please refer to your device's user manual and guides for more details.[/iOS] [Android]The way to equip the widget differs depending on the device.
Touch and hold the home screen. The widget settings icon should appear. Selecting the icon will display the widgets you can set on your device. Tap the Digimon ReArise widget to place it on your home screen. To remove the widget, tap and hold the widget until the delete option appears.
Android allows use of SD cards as internal storage, but widgets cannot be used for applications installed on an Android device's SD card. Functions may differ depending on the device used. Please refer to your device's user manual and guides for more details. [/Android]

Bond is an indicator of the faith between a Tamer and a Digimon. It is a vital parameter for Digivolution; a Digimon will not be able to Digivolve if its Bond is too low.
Bond increases as you gain Bond Points by going on Quests with a Digimon, or by giving them items in Care Mode.

You will receive regular notifications from your Digimon. Different Digimon have different sets of dialogue, so set different Digimon as your Partner Digimon to see them all.
You can also activate the app by tapping the widget.

You can purchase DigiRubies and exchange them for items at the Shop. Avaliable items change from time to time, so be sure to check out the Shop frequently.
• Purchasing DigiRubies 　You can purchase DigiRubies with real money. • Sale/Training Set/Standard 　You can spend DigiRubies to purchase items. • DigiDiamond Exchange 　Exchange DigiDiamonds for Digimon. • BP Medal Exchange 　Exchange BP Medals for items. • Master Medal Exchange 　Exchange Master Medals for items. • CB Medal Exchange 　Exchange CB Medals for items. • DigiOrb Exchange 　Exchange DigiOrbs for items. • Ranking Medal Exchange 　Exchange Ranking Medals for items. • Social Pt. Exchange 　Exchange Social Pts. for items.

Each item has an available stock, and may eventually run out. An item cannot be purchased once its available stock drops to zero.
Items are restocked over time.
Limited-time items will not be restocked over time. Some items may be restocked even if they have a limited-time availability.

The Digidex is a comprehensive list of Digimon in the game. You can view a Digimon's detailed profile by tapping on their icon.
Digimon you have not befriended are grayed out and their profiles cannot be viewed.

Missions are goals that earn rewards when achieved. A notification is displayed on-screen when a Mission is accomplished. There are 4 types of Missions:
- Daily Missions New missions assigned every day. Relatively simple objectives, and a bonus Completion Reward is given for accomplishing all of them. - Weekly Mission New missions assigned every week. These are more difficult than Daily Missions, but completing the whole thing nets you a bonus Completion Reward. - Totals Missions Missions that count totals tallied from when you first started playing the game. Many of these missions require time to complete. - Special Missions Missions activated by specific events. Once all objectives are completed such missions are no longer displayed.
Actions taken during the tutorial phase are not tallied.

Mission Rewards can be obtained by tapping the Mission button at the top-right of the DigiTown screen.
You can earn a variety of Rewards by accomplishing Missions.
Available Rewards can be viewed on the Mission screen.

Daily Missions and Weekly Missions have expiration dates of one day and one week, respectively, resetting when their time limits have passed.
